main_definition: Bestsellers are books, products, or other items that have sold exceptionally well and reached the top of sales charts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In literature, a bestseller refers to a book that has sold an unusually large number of copies in a short period of time.
meanings_and_examples.example: The Harry Potter series by J.K. Rowling is considered one of the most famous examples of literary bestsellers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In commerce, a product or item can be classified as a bestseller if it outperforms its competitors and ranks high on sales charts.
meanings_and_examples.example: The iPhone 12 series was released to great fanfare in 2020 and quickly became a tech industry bestseller.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In music, an album or single that achieves widespread popularity and sells numerous copies is referred to as a musical bestseller.
meanings_and_examples.example: Michael Jackson's 'Thriller' is one of the best-known examples of a music bestseller.
